src:
Hore, Imigrasi Buka Layanan Paspor di Depok Town Square
07 Nov 2019, 20:30 by Rido Lingga, S.Kom


Hore, Imigrasi Buka Layanan Paspor di Depok Town Square

KBRN, Depok: Ada kabar gembira bagi warga Kota Depok yang ingin plesiran keluar negeri. Pasalnya Dirjen Imigrasi membuka pelayanan membuat dan pergantian paspor di Unit Layanan Paspor (ULP) di Depok Town Square (Detos) di Jalan Raya Margonda.Sebelumnya ULP, Kantor Imigrasi Kelas II Non TPI Kota Depok yang berada di Mall ini belum dilengkapi dengan pelayanan paspos."Masyarakat yang ingin mengurus paspor, bisa datang ke Lantai 1 Mall Detos sekarang," kata Kepala Kantor Imigrasi Kelas II Non TPI Kota Depok Agung Wibowo, usai peresmian ULP di Detos, Kota Depok, Kamis (07/11/2019).Agung mengatakan, pelayanan paspor di Mall ini sama dengan kantor Imigrasi Kelas II Non TPI Kota Depok yang berada di Grand Depok City (GDC). Pihaknya membuka ULP di Detos untuk mempermudah masyarakat yang ingin mengurus paspor."Jadi tidak menumpuk semua dokumen pengurusan pemohon di kantor Imigrasi di GDC," katanya.Gerai UPL Detos, sambung Agung dimulai pada pukul 08:00-16.00 WIB. Untuk harinya buka dari Senin sampai Jumat. "Kita buka setiap hari kerja mulai pukul 08:00-16:00 WIB," ujarnya.Masih di lokasi yang sama, Direktur Jenderal (Dirjen) Kementerian Hukum dan HAM Bambang Rantam menambahkan, UPL ini sudah dilengkapi dengan aplikasi Indeks Kepuasan Masyarakat (IKM) agar petugas dapat melayani masyarakat dengan baik. IKM ini merupakan bentuk komitmen Dirjen Imigrasi dalam menyongsong zona integritas.IKM adalah bentuk penilaian pemohon terhadap pelayanan yang diberikan petugas dengan cara menekan tombol indeks kepuasan yang tersedia di setiap meja petugas yang memberikan pelayanan."Masyarakat tinggal menekan tombol seberapa baiknya pelayanan yang diberikan oleh pegawai-pegawai dibawah Kakanim Kelas II Non TPI Kota Depok ini," ujar Bambang dilokasi.Bambang selaku Dirjen Imigrasi mengaku memberikan apresiasi kepada Kepala Kantor Imigrasi Kelas II Non TPI Kota Depok Agung Wibowo selaku Kanim yang lebih dahulu memberikan penilaian kepada anak buahnya melalui aplikasi yang diberi nama Piawai Aplikasi IKM."Kepala kantor bisa langsung melakukan pemantauan atau pengawasan real-time apabila ada petugas yang mendapatkan indeks pelayanan kurang bagus dari masyarakat. Sehingga bisa langsung di intervensi," jelasnya."Kepada petugas ada reward dan punishment. Rewardnya bisa dikaitkan dengan pemberian tunjangan kinerja dan kalau punismentnya bisa dengan pembimbingan. Dan jejak digital aplikasi ini dapat dilihat oleh Ombudsman dan Menpan RB untuk kepentingan evaluasi dan sebagainya," tambahnya.
text:
Hooray, Immigration Opens Passport Service in Depok Town Square
07 Nov 2019, 20:30 by Rido Lingga, S.Kom


Hooray, Immigration Opens Passport Service in Depok Town Square

KBRN, Depok: There is good news for the citizens of Depok who want to enjoy going abroad. Because the Director General of Immigration opened the service of making and changing passports in the Passport Service Unit (ULP) in Depok Town Square (Detos) on Jalan Raya Margonda. Previously, the ULP, the Immigration Class II Non TPI Office in Depok, which was in the Mall, was not yet equipped with passport services. "People who want to take care of a passport, can come to the 1st floor of the Detos Mall now," said Head of the Immigration Class II Non-TPI Depok City Agung Wibowo, after the inauguration of the ULP in Detos, Depok City, Thursday (11/07/2019). , the passport service at the Mall is the same as the Non-TPI Class II Immigration Office in Depok, which is located in Grand Depok City (GDC). He said he opened an ULP at Detos to make it easier for people who wanted to take care of their passports. "So, they did not pile up all documents for the application of the applicant at the Immigration Office at GDC," he said. The UPL Detos Movement, continued Agung, began at 08: 00-16.00 WIB. The day is open Monday through Friday. "We open every working day from 08: 00-16: 00 WIB," he said. Still in the same location, the Director General (Dirjen) of the Ministry of Law and Human Rights Bambang Rantam added, the UPL was already equipped with the Community Satisfaction Index (IKM) application ) so that officers can serve the community well. This IKM is a form of the Director General of Immigration's commitment in welcoming the integrity zone. ICM is a form of appraisal of the applicant's services provided by pressing the satisfaction index button available at each desk of officers who provide services. "The public just needs to press the button how well the services provided by employees "Employees under the Class II Non-TPI Depok City Kakanim," Bambang said on location. Bambang as the Director General of Immigration claimed to give appreciation to the Head of the Immigration Class II Non TPI Depok City Agung Wibowo as Kanim who first gave an assessment to his subordinates through the application given "The head of the office can directly conduct real-time monitoring or supervision if there are officers who get a poor service index from the community. So that they can be directly intervened," he explained. "To officers there is reward and punishment. The reward can be attributed to granting allowances ki nerja and if possible, with guidance. And the digital footprint of this application can be seen by the Ombudsman and Menpan RB for the sake of evaluation and so on, "he added.
